actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Rules.

official_title: Resolution creating a select committee to study the impact and ramifications of the Supreme Court decisions on abortion.

summary.text: Establishes a select committee in the House of Representatives to conduct a full and complete study of the constitutional basis of the January 22, 1973, United States Supreme Court decisions on abortion, the ramifications of such decisions on the power of the States to enact abortion legislation, and the need for remedial action by Congress on the subject of abortions. Sets forth the powers and authority of the committee. Directs the committee to report to the House within six months the results of its study, together with such recommendations as it deems advisable.

titles.title: Resolution creating a select committee to study the impact and ramifications of the Supreme Court decisions on abortion.
